author: Matthew Evans
title: Pension Credit warning before Winter Fuel Payment deadline
text:
Unpaid carers have been urged to apply for Pension Credit before the Winter Fuel Payment deadline.
According to the charity Carers UK, only those receiving Pension Credit or means-tested benefits will receive the one-off Winter Fuel Payment of up to Â£300 to help pay energy bills from this winter.
There are 1.2 million unpaid carers over the age of 65 in England and Wales, with 729,000 of those providing over 20 hours of care per week and 551,000 providing over 50 hours per week.
It's really important to claim Pension Credit and to do so quickly before 21st December.

Recent figures from Carers UK show the financial pressure that older carers are already under and the potential challenges they will face if the Winter Fuel Payment is removed from everyone apart from those in receipt of Pension Credit.

Unpaid carers are more likely to be eligible for Pension Credit. They can also get extra income worth up to Â£2,371 per year if they meet certain conditions.
